sensors
Class UltrasonicPoller

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      sensors.UltrasonicPoller
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class UltrasonicPoller
extends java.lang.Thread

ultrasonicPoller will poll the ultrasonic sensor periodically and call which ever UltrasonicListener that should run when reaching certain distance. this is a event driven approach and should be (hopefully) faster than the while loop setting flag approach TODO add public enable() pause()

Author:
yuechuan

subscribe

public boolean subscribe(UltrasonicListener uListener)
subscribe the listener to the ultrasonicPoller if and only if there are no duplicates in the Arraylist that keeps the UltrasonicListeners. or else update the values in the list. if the UltrasonicListener already exist in the list then do nothing and return true.

Parameters:
uListener -
distanceOnInvoke -
continuous -
Returns:
true if subscriber is duplicated

unsubscribe

public boolean unsubscribe(UltrasonicListener uListener)
remove a UltrasonicListener from the arraylist of executables

Parameters:
uListener -
Returns:
true when unsubscribe successful, if the item does not exist in the stack then return false

getDistance

public int getDistance()
Get the last distance value polled from sensor.
Note
it is possible to call this method many times before the distance value is updated again from the sensor. the mean calculated from these data will be wrong. a way to avoid polling the value numerous times is by using the method hasDistanceUpdated(), example code :
if (hasDistanceUpdated()) value = getDistance()

distance refresh rate around 20hz

Returns:

hasDistanceUpdated

public boolean hasDistanceUpdated()
Returns:
true when the distance is updated since the last time getDistance is called.

objectDetected

public boolean objectDetected()
Deprecated. no reason to use this , but forgot why I put it here

check for threshold and return true if there is a possible block

Returns:
